content: If you're interested in learning more about the history and philosophy behind the Veda, I would recommend starting with "The Rigveda: A Historical Analysis" by Shrikant Talageri. This book provides a detailed analysis of the history and archaeology behind the Veda, including its origins, the cultural context in which it was developed, and its role in ancient Indian society. It also offers an in-depth look at the philosophical teachings contained within the Veda. Another book that may be of interest to you is "The Upanishads: A New Translation" by Swami Nikhilananda. This book offers a translation and commentary on the Upanishads, which are part of the Veda and contain some of the most influential philosophical teachings in Indian history. Both of these books offer different perspectives on the Veda and its teachings, so you may find that one or the other resonates more with you. Regardless of which one you choose, I think you'll find that they both offer fascinating insights into the history and philosophy behind one of the world's oldest spiritual traditions.
